SUBRE
82.-2-
Residents of Muthialamma Gudi
Street, Door No. 2-94, Village Turangi, Kakinada Rural Mandal, East Godavari District, Sons of Talliboina (Late) Satyam Gari 1) Talliboina Tatarau (Age 57 Years) (Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX), Ditto Address,
Door No. 2-95 residents, 2) Taliboin Daruplu (Age 53 years) (Aadhaar
No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) A joint deed of the department called Parikhattu.
We are brothers born in the same womb.
The properties as per the below schedules are our taluk properties. That is, our father, Taliboin Satyam, enjoyed his ancestral property with full rights and did not write any documents about the property during his lifetime. Similarly, our mother also passed away. After two years, we got a land of 123.48 sq. m. in Turangi village taluk. And we We have purchased a plot of land measuring 42 sq m in Turangi village taluk from Yamala Durga on 25-07-1992 with our own money, and have registered the purchase deed in the Kakinada Registrar's Office in Book 1, Volume 2370, Page 479, Page 481 as D. No. 4235/1992. The said plot of land measuring 42 sq m and the plot of land measuring 123.48 sq m acquired by us after our father, totaling 165.48 sq m, have been acquired jointly by both of us. In the said property acquired by us in the above manner, we have acquired a R.C.C. roof terrace with our own money. Having built the house and the house of the father-in-law, we have been enjoying the said property jointly with our full right of possession from that day to this day. However, rather than enjoying the said property jointly, it is better to divide it into shares and develop the property according to whose share it has come. Therefore, the said property has been divided into two unequal shares, A and B, in the order of good and bad, with the help of the elders, and it has been arranged that the first of us will take the share marked 'A' and the second of us will take the share marked 'B'. According to the said arrangement, the share marked 'A' and the second of us will take possession of the property according to whose share it has come. 1. The date of the birth of the mother-in-law 2. The doors of the mother-in-law Bk 1, CS No 5835/2015 & Doct no
5513/2015.

SUBRE-3-
Hence the share that accrues from this to whose share They shall be the full rightful owners of the property and shall enjoy it freely and freely through their children and grandchildren, paying taxes and other duties. These are the fixed shares. Therefore, no one can ever argue that this distribution is not correct, that there are advantages and disadvantages, that it should be redistributed, or that seals should be given. Even if they do so, they will not be valid. Except for the fact that we have divided the property according to the schedules and have signed this deed of inheritance on this day, neither we nor any of us nor any of us shall have any mortgages, purchases, purchase agreements, guarantees, donations, court seizures, attachments, etc. That there have been no written agreements, that the property is undisputed, that the numbers, boundaries, measurements, limits, etc. are correct, that there are no other claimants than us, that we have no pre-existing rights, that we are co-owners and co-parceners, that we have no other property to share except this property, that there are no other main heirs to this property except us, and that from all this, we have said among ourselves and trusted each other and have written this section document called Parikhat.
The property assigned as per the schedules of the A.P. Act 9/77 No. Agreements are hereby filed to register the share property in the name of the person to whom the property is transferred in the records of the Government. A copy of this deed should also be registered. The original deed of deed should be taken by us 1st and the duplicate copy should be taken by us 2nd. The deed of deed shall be valid as original title deed for the person to whom it is transferred.
Declaration: We hereby confirm that there are no gardens, mines, fish ponds, etc. in the property of the Schedules.

reportJson.ownerName1: Thalliboyina Ratnam, Jalataru Appayyama, Thalliboyina Durga Prasad and Thalliboyina Padma (Legal Heirs of Late.  Talliboyina Talupulu) and  legal heirs of Late Thalliboyina Srinu (subject to verification)

sections.content: The property acquired by Talliboyina Talupulu by virtue of Partition Deed No. 5513 of 2015, dated 16/May/ 2015, being Schedule-B, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 65.66 Sq. Yds. (or) 590.939 Sq. Ft., bearing house number 2-95 comprised in Survey Number 92/1, situated in Toorangi village and Gram Panchayath, Kakinada Rural Mandal, Erst while East Godavari Now within the District of Kakinada, registered at Sub-Registrar Office, Kakinada (R.O), is bounded as follows: North by: 39.0 Ft or 11.88 Mts Property of Savarampudi Apparao South by: 38.6 Ft or 11.73 Mts. In A Schedule Property 3rd Item to Some Extent & 1st Item to Some Extent East by: 15 Ft. or 4.57 Mts. 2nd Item in A Schedule Property West by: 15.6 Ft 0r 4.72 Mts Panchayati Cement Road Note: It is to be noted that our legal verification is limited towards the property offered as security for the purpose of loan, i.e., Schedule-B, property of the Partition Deed.

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 92/1, bearing house no. 2-95, situated in Toorangi measuring about 65.66 Sq. Yds. (or) 590.939 Sq. Ft., and other extent was originally owned by Talliboyina Talupulu and Talliboyina Tatarao who acquired the property through inheritance after demise of their parants. [Ref: Deed]. 2. The aforementioned Talliboyina Tata Rao & Talliboyina Talupulu executed a Partition Deed on 16/May/2015 registered as document No. 5513 of 2015, before the SRO Kakinada (R.O) amongst them Talliboyina Talupulu acquired right over Schedule 'B' property of partition deed measuring an extent of 65.66 Sq. Yds. (or) 590.939 Sq. Ft., bearing house no. 2-95, comprised in survey no.92/1, situated at Toorangi. 3. Thereupon, the said Thalliboyina Thalupulu died intestate on 28/10/2019 as evidenced by the Death Certificate issued by the Registrar of Births & Deaths, Grama Panchayat, Toorangi vide Registration No.D-2019-28-90104-000096, dated 02/11/2019, leaving behind 1. Thalliboyina Ratnam (Wife) , 2. Jalataru Appayamma (Daughter), 3. Thalliboyina Durga Prasad (Son), 4. Thalliboyina Padma (Daughter-in-law) as his family members, as evidenced by the Family Member Certificate issued by the Tahsildhar, Kakinada (Rural) Mandal, vide No.FMC250108037490, dated 25/01/2025. it is further noted that one of his sons, Thalliboyina Srinu, predeceased him on 07/05/2019, as evidenced by the Death Certificate issued by the Registrar of Births & Deaths, GGH, Kakinada, vide Registration No. D-2019-28-90216-002158, dated 08/05/2019. Note:However, the Family Member Certificate / Legal Heir Certificate of Late Thalliboyina Srinu was not made available for our perusal and, as such, we are unable to ascertain whether there are any other legal heirs apart from those drived from given documents. Upon enquiry, the F.I. has reverted for conditional report. Therefore, the F.I. is advised to obtain the Family Member Certificate of Late Thalliboyina Srinu, and include all his legal heirs in the loan structure, Further, if any minor legal heir is identified in the Family Member Certificate of Late Thalliboyina Srinu, the F.I. shall obtain the necessary court order/permission from the competent court, Hence F.I has to verify the same and proceed accordingly Note: It is to be noted that upon the demise of Thalliboyina Talupulu and Thalliboyina Srinu, their respective legal heirs, namely Thalliboyina Ratnam, Jalataru Appayyamma, Thalliboyina Durga Prasad, Thalliboyina Padma, and the legal heirs of Late Thalliboyina Srinu (subject to verification), became the absolute owners of the schedule property. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : Note: It is to be noted that the HTR or Mutation was not attached in this case, when the same is enquired with F.I., they reverted to release a conditional report. It is therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain HTR or Mutation prior to the loan disbursement of the loan.
The mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner,  Talliboyina Talupulu .

Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type
Mortgage Deed* Mortgage Deed in favour of Vistaar Finance executed by  Talliboyina Talupulu *----------* Original

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the legal heirs of Late Thalliboyina Talupulu, namely Thalliboyina Ratnam, Jalataru Appayyamma, Thalliboyina Durga Prasad, and Thalliboyina Padma, together with the legal heirs of Late Thalliboyina Srinu (subject to verification), possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property admeasuring an extent of 65.66 Sq. Yds. (or) 590.939 Sq. Ft., bearing house number 2-95, comprised in Survey Number 92/1, situated in Toorangi village and Gram Panchayath, Kakinada Rural Mandal, Erst while East Godavari Now within the District of Kakinada, registered at Sub-Registrar Office, Kakinada (R.O).

Further, Thalliboyina Ratnam, Jalataru Appayyamma, and Thalliboyina Padma, together with the legal heirs of Late Thalliboyina Srinu (subject to verification) is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant  Talliboyina Durga Prasad.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
